projects.title: Mandatory Registration of FIR – Reference Case: Lalita Kumari v Government of Uttar Pradesh
projects.description:
This paper analysis, Sections 154, 155 and 156 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 and
various other provisions and the rules to be followed with regards to the mandatory registration
of FIR under the Code of Criminal Procedure, by referring to the judgment Lalita Kumari v.
Government of Uttar Pradesh delivered on 2014 which provides with the dealing of the information
given in a FIR and its legal implications. The information which is received and recorded as
under Section 154 of the Code is usually known and referred to as the First Information Report.

As will be analyzed in the paper, the evidentiary value of the First Information Report is far
greater than any other statement as recorded by the police officer – in – charge of the concerned
Police Station during the course of the investigation procedure. The Supreme Court has ruled
that, since the expression “information” is not qualified as credible or reasonable, in such a
situation the police officer – in – charge of the Police Station is duty bound to register the
information as provided under Section 154 of the Code .

profile_positions.title: Marketing Executive

profile_positions.description: The United Nations Volunteers (UNV) programme contributes to peace and development through volunteerism worldwide. Online volunteering allows organizations and volunteers to team up to address sustainable development challenges – anywhere in the world, from any device. It allows volunteers to develop their skills and take on new roles that their professional life may not necessarily provide. Organizations collaborate with people of different backgrounds from all over the world, and become part of a global online community of peers who all share the goal of advancing human development. When skilled, passionate individuals join forces online with great organizations working toward sustainable development goals, everyone wins.
profile_positions.title: Volunteer

- Provide analytical and well documented recruiting reports to the rest of the team
- Act as a point of contact and build influential candidate relationships during the selection process

profile_positions.description:
7 Cups (formerly called 7 Cups of Tea) is a website (also available in an app) which provides online therapy and free support to people experiencing emotional distress by connecting them with trained listeners. The listener, trained in active listening, interacts with the person seeking help via an anonymous and confidential chat.

Active Listener duties and responsibilities:
- Providing online support to clients with issues relating to depression, anxiety, sexual abuse, parenting, panic attacks, work stress, LGBTQ+ and managing emotions from diverse group (age, gender, nationality)
profile_positions.title: Active Listener/Counselor

profile_positions.description:
Global Leading Conferences (GLC) is a market leader in constructing industry focused events where business meets intelligence. We are specialized in major industries such as; Pharmaceutical, Finance, Energy, Oil & Gas and Human Resources, and we structure our events by investigating into market challenges and top issues that industries endure to render the most effective learning and networking platforms by creating impactful and pragmatic Business to Business Conferences, Congresses & Training.

Duties and responsibilities:
- Marketing and organizational tasks 
- Data analytics and market research
- Providing marketing and organizational database management for various countries like Hungary, Poland, Austria, Jordan, Iran, UK, UAE, Germany etc
- Managing purchases
- Organizing meetings and appointments
- General assistance
- Other administrative tasks
profile_positions.title: Marketing Assistant
